sect2.title: Contents
sect2.para: The Gzip package contains the compress, gunzip, gzexe, gzip, uncompress, zcat, zcmp, zdiff, zforce, zgrep, zmore and znew programs.

sect3.title: gunzip, uncompress
sect3.para: gunzip and uncompress decompress files which are compressed with gzip.

sect3.title: gzexe
sect3.para: gzexe allows you to compress executables in place and have them automatically uncompress and execute when they are run (at a penalty in performance).

sect3.title: gzip
sect3.para: gzip reduces the size of the named files using Lempel-Ziv coding (LZ77).

sect3.title: zcat
sect3.para: zcat uncompresses either a list of files on the command line or its standard input and writes the uncompressed data on standard output

sect3.title: zcmp
sect3.para: zcmp invokes the cmp program on compressed files.

sect3.title: zdiff
sect3.para: zdiff invokes the diff program on compressed files.

sect3.title: zforce
sect3.para: zforce forces a .gz extension on all gzip files so that gzip will not compress them twice. This can be useful for files with names truncated after a file transfer.

sect3.title: zgrep
sect3.para: zgrep invokes the grep program on compressed files.

sect3.title: zmore
sect3.para: zmore is a filter which allows examination of compressed or plain text files one screen at a time on a soft-copy terminal (similar to the more program).

sect3.title: znew
sect3.para: znew re-compresses files from .Z (compress) format to .gz (gzip) format.
